sophietheuunifawn: Hannah you look so gorgeous. I look up to you as a role model for body confidence and adapting to radical changes. I don't have a stoma but I had appendicitis a few years ago that required surgery and it was difficult for me to accept that I had scars, as small as they are, for a while. It was such a big deal for me to share my body with others, and I think that if I was still in that place you would have inspired me so much. Thank you for being so brave and embracing your new body. You've helped so many people. I only wish I had had someone like you when I was 15 and recovering from my surgery. Keep empowering all bodies to embrace who we are ❤

dejalaquefluya_: Hey Hannah, you're power. I had 10cm of my colon removed just 3 days after my birth and my mother always told me about my days with a so little stoma when I was just a few days old. Doctors were able to completely fix my insides so I've grown up without the stoma but because there was a problem with the stitches they had to suture me again leaving a rather prominent scar. I'm 23 y/o and still trying to come to terms with it, so watching someone exposing themselves like you're doing, even knowing confidence sure has its up and downs, is something I've been needing to see through my whole life. Thank you for this, you look awesome inside and outside.
